meanings.definition: Having or showing dogged determination not to change one's attitude or position on something.
meanings.sent1: The stubborn child refused to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She is known for her stubborn refusal to compromise.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat wouldn't budge from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: His stubborn belief in aliens made him an outcast among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The stubborn oak tree stood tall against the strong winds.

meanings.definition: Difficult to move, remove, or cure.
meanings.sent1: The stubborn stain on the carpet wouldn't come out.
meanings.sent2: The old rusty bolt was stubborn and wouldn't turn.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn jar lid refused to open no matter how hard she tried.
meanings.sent4: Her stubborn headache persisted despite taking painkillers.
meanings.sent5: The stubborn knot in the rope was impossible to untangle.

meanings.definition: A person with an obstinate or unyielding disposition.
meanings.sent1: The stubborn always insisted on having things done his way.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled as a stubborn by her classmates for never changing her mind.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn at the office never listened to anyone else's ideas.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the stubborn of the family for his rigid beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The stubborn was determined to finish the race despite the injury.
